pages.text: Welcome to the chapter about nuclear bombs!$(br)Get the latest information about weapons here!

pages.title: Detonator
pages.text: To start using bombs, you'll first need a $(item)$(l)Detonator$() (see crafting recipe above).$(br)By shift-right-clicking a block, you set the $(l)targeted position$(), which it will attempt to detonate on right-click!$(br)If the targeted position is invalid, nothing will happen.

pages.title: Incendiary Charge
pages.text: This nice looking bomb isn't all too destructive, but has one special property: its $(l)incendiary$()!$(br)This means that detonating it sets the surrounding area on fire. Pretty cool, right?

pages.title: Nuclear Charge
pages.text: Ah, the Nuclear Charge. A classic, it has been here since the beginning!$(br)This nuclear bomb is the weakest variant, with a blast radius of $(l)16$().

pages.title: Little Boy
pages.text: The Little Boy is the strongest survival-obtainable bomb.$(br)Not extremely strong, but still quite powerful with a blast radius of $(l)64$().
This bomb is very strong!$(br)Not recommended for weak computers, as its blast radius is $(l)256$() and the explosion algorithm is to cry about.

The dropped soulfire bomb is uncraftable, but can be naturally found throughout the world of Minecraft.$(br)Detonating it creates a soulfire mushroom cloud, and the blast doesn't leave any nuclear remains!$(br)The blast radius of $(l)32$() still is quite destructive.

Nuclear bombs are no fun without any drawbacks! That's why they leave all these $(item)$(l)nuclear remains$() everywhere.$(br)The cooled down variants aren't dangerous, but the hot ones are very radioactive and set you on fire!
